meanings.definition: To cause to become stiff or rigid
meanings.sent1: The cold weather can sometimes lead to ankylosing of the joints.
meanings.sent2: After sitting in the same position for too long, my legs started ankylosing.
meanings.sent3: Trying to dance with heavy boots on was like ankylosing my feet to the floor.
meanings.sent4: His strict rules seemed to ankylose any room for creativity in the project.
meanings.sent5: The rust on the old gate had ankylosed it shut, making it impossible to open.

meanings.definition: To undergo fusion of the vertebrae in the spine
meanings.sent1: Over time, the condition may progress and result in ankylosing of the spine.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how the disease causes the vertebrae to ankylose together.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's superpower was the ability to ankylose his spine at will.
meanings.sent4: The ancient tree roots seemed to ankylose with the rocks, forming a solid structure.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces seemed to ankylose together, creating a seamless picture.

meanings.sent1: The ankylosing joints made it difficult for him to bend down and tie his shoes.
meanings.sent2: The old robot moved slowly, its ankylosing limbs struggling to keep up.
meanings.sent3: The ankylosing door creaked loudly as it opened, as if protesting its own stiffness.
meanings.sent4: The ankylosing tree branches reached out like frozen fingers in the winter air.
meanings.sent5: The ankylosing metal gate stood still, guarding the entrance to the garden.
